answers.answer: Kathy,Many people who suffer with depression recurrently require a maintainance dose of an antidepressant.  This idea is similar to those who have high blood pressure or diabetes and need medication to control these diseases.  The goal of treatment should always be to enable the patient to function at the optimal capability.  Hope this was helpful.Sincerely,HFHS MD-JMKeywords:  Antidepressants, depression

I am like that.  I have been depressed and had anxiety disorder since I was 3 years old.  I am now 24 and have finally gotten a handle on it.  My doctor has told me that I may need (probably will need to) take the medication (Zoloft and Trazadone) for the rest of my life.  That really doesn't bother me though because taking the medication is a lot easier than dealing with anxiety and depression. (I did quit taking it once and the anxiety and depression came back worse than ever).  Good luck.

question: Is it within the realm of possibility that a person will be depressed their whole life? I have been on antidepressants for years and everytime that I try to wean myself off of them I feel like I can't handle even ordinary every day problems. I get anxious and explosive and feel very hopeless. Are there people like this?
title: Will I always be depressed?
